## defSetter() function

Type checked version of [defSetterUnsafe](./paths.defsetterunsafe.md)<!-- -->. Only the first 8 path levels are type checked.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function defSetter<T>(path: Path0): Fn2<T, T, T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  path | <code>Path0</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Fn2<T, T, T>`

## Remarks

Due to the higher-order nature of this function, generics for path validation must be given and so this function is more verbose than  (where the generics can usually be fully inferred).

## Example 1


```ts
type State = { a: { b: number } };

const setB = defSetter<State, "a", "b">(["a", "b"]);

setB({ a: { b: 1 } }, 2); // ok!
setB({ a: { b: 1 } }, "2"); // error!

```

## Example 2


```ts
type State = { a: { b: number } };

const path = <const>["a","b"];

const setB = defSetter<State, typeof path[0], typeof path[1]>(path);

```
